content:
Hi!
I'm the team leader of wg-allocators but I'm not allowed to ping my team with @rustbot ping wg-allocators. Is this a bug? Or a feature, which was forgotten to be implemented?
Are you not in the rust-lang organization?
No, only listed in rust-lang/teams. I guess rustbot does not look up the team members?
you can ask in #t-release/triagebot btw

I think working groups are currently on a case by case basis - we should create a GitHub team for wg allocators though regardless, since the ping command IIRC isn't intended for that sort of ping (though I might be misremembering)
(if there was a GitHub team, you could directly cc it as a member)

DPC said:

you can ask in #t-release/triagebot btw

I was unsure where to put this issue. The bot mentioned this team but I think this is more related to #t-infra.

simulacrum said:

I think working groups are currently on a case by case basis - we should create a GitHub team for wg allocators though regardless, since the ping command IIRC isn't intended for that sort of ping (though I might be misremembering)

That would be great! This way I could also cc other teams like t-libs, right? As the WG is a subteam of t-libs, this would come in handy.

You should be able to create such a team by PR'ing the team repo and adding a github section to the team definition -- if you grep for rust-lang or github you should find examples. I can approve such a PR.
And yes, t-infra would be better for this sort of question than here (going to move it over there).
This topic was moved here from #t-release > Can't ping my own team by simulacrum

simulacrum said:

You should be able to create such a team by PR'ing the team repo and adding a github section to the team definition -- if you grep for rust-lang or github you should find examples. I can approve such a PR.

Ah okay. So I have to add this?:

[[github]]
orgs = ["rust-lang"]
